creditline: Gift of Dr. Roger L. Anderson in memory of Agnes Lynch Anderson
text: A cunning monkey persuades a cat to retrieve roasting chestnuts from a fire. It's a scene from Jean de La Fontaine's 17th-century fable that spawned the term "cat's paw"â€”someone unwittingly duped by another. But the cold brutality of the image is not in keeping with the original illustrations of his stories, created a couple centuries before the Romantic painters and satirists of the 1800s revived La Fontaine's use of animal antics to symbolize human struggles.
title: The Cat's Paw
